intro: Perrierangraecum dryadum, commonly known as the dryad’s spurge, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and milky sap. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Perrierangraecum dryadum is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it adapts well to arid conditions.
